column2: This character has aggressively broken a truce or a peace agreement.
This character has been spending his gold with generosity and lordly extravagance.
'Has restored the power of the Old Gods'.
'Has recently claimed the High Kingdom of Britannia'.
'Has recently claimed the Cynerice of Ænglaland'.
This character resents being ruled by a liege who has no natural rights to the land.
Challenged to a Duel on the Battlefield
This character is currently hiding from the hostile forces ravaging through the realm.
This character has decided not to hide, but to hold strong against the hostile forces ravaging through the realm.
This character is studying the basics of the druidic arts.
This character is studying the druidic arts and is well-versed with many of its basics.
This character is studying the secrets of the druids and has mastered many of the facets of the art.
This character has chosen to become a bard, but has also learned much from the basic druidic training required of a bard.
This character has recently raised an army from Hispania and cannot raise another one for the next few years.
A number of new settlements have recently been founded in this province.
This character is being praised and honoured in the stories and poems of the local bards.
This character has been the subject of some stinging mockery and satire by local bards.
This character has wilfully abandoned Christianity for another religion, earning the ire and fury of all Christians.
Many Christians have never quite forgiven this character for abandoning Christianity before reconverting.
This character is enjoying peaceful relations with the Romans of Gaul.
Continued debasement of coinage has decreased public confidence in the currency and is causing economic problems in the province.
The Imperator has refused to pay the traditional Donativum on his succession, greatly angering the army.
Our coffers are empty and we cannot afford to pay our troops properly.
Our coffers are empty and we cannot afford to pay our troops properly.
Our coffers are empty and we cannot afford to pay our troops properly.
Our coffers are empty and we cannot afford to pay our troops properly.
Our coffers are empty and we cannot afford to pay our troops properly.
Our coffers are empty and we cannot afford to pay our troops properly.
Our coffers are empty and we cannot afford to pay our troops properly.
This ruler has full control over northern Gaul and over the entire southern coast of the Dividing Sea.
This Frankish ruler has full control over northern Gaul and over the entire southern coast of the Dividing Sea.
This ruler is reigning from a province that follows a completely different religious faith, making administration more difficult.
This ruler is reigning from a province that follows a slightly different religious faith, making administration more difficult.
This ruler's martial skills are so laughable most of his vassals are unwilling to send their troops to fight under his command.
This ruler's martial skills are very low, and most of his vassals are unwilling to send their troops to fight under his command.
This ruler's low martial skills are causing concern among his vassals, who are unwilling to send their troops to fight under his command.
This ruler is considered a proficient military leader. His vassals will be more inclined to send their troops to war under his command.
This ruler is considered a skilled strategist and military leader. His vassals will be more inclined to send their troops to war under his command.
This ruler is considered a masterful strategist and a great military leader. In times of war, his vassals will be more inclined to send their troops to fight under his command.
This ruler is a master in intriguing and plotting.
This character's realm is being torn by the current war.
This ruler is inept in the fine art of politics.
This ruler's stewardship skills are so laughable he can't even start to fight corruption.
This ruler is a master in administrating his realm, and everything runs as smoothly as ever.
This ruler is not spiritual at all, preferring human arts and progress to the answers religion could offer him.
This ruler is a very religious character who despises human arts and progress and prefers to find the answers to life's greatest dilemmas in his religious faith.
This ruler is one of the greatest cultural and intellectual minds of their time.
This ruler is uneducated and ignorant about most of the things that happen even just outside his great hall.
This ruler is wealthy and has no problems paying or paying back any gold spent.
This Anglo-Saxon ruler holds more than one king title, a fact disliked by most of his vassals.
This Anglo-Saxon ruler holds more than one king title, a fact disliked by most of his vassals.
This Bretwalda of Ænglaland holds more than one king title, a fact disliked by most of his vassals.

This ruler's diplomacy and stewardship skills are not good enough to properly administer such a large realm. Widespread corruption is chronic and is fueling frustration and disillusionment among both the vassals and the people.

This ruler's diplomacy and stewardship skills are not good enough to properly administer such a large realm. Widespread corruption is chronic and is fueling frustration and disillusionment among both the vassals and the people.

This ruler's diplomacy and stewardship skills are not good enough to properly administer such a large realm. Widespread corruption is chronic and is fueling frustration and disillusionment among both the vassals and the people.
This ruler has denied the authority of the Senate in Rome and formed an Imperial Senate in his capital city.

This character has proven himself on the battlefield and inspires his people like few others. He is considered one of the great conquerors of his time, and his soldiers are willing to follow him from campaign to campaign with barely a rest, to all four corners of the world.

The maximum amount of troops and taxes that can be raised from vassals depends on the §Ynumber of holdings§! in the realm. Larger realms with decentralized armies can raise fewer troops and collect fewer taxes per vassal.\n\nThe effects of decentralization are reduced under higher Crown Authority and Centralization Laws.

This ruler's lack of authority and prestige is cause of frustration among both the vassals and the people.

This king has nothing but a few settlements left under his rule. The realm is just a shadow of its former glory. If the kingdom is to be respected, it must prove itself worthy and regain its de jure territory once again.
Our war is a just war. The people of the realm know this, and they support our effort with gold and fervour.
The limited size of this ruler's personal holdings allows for a far more efficient tax collection.
The limited size of this ruler's personal holdings allows for a far more efficient tax collection.
The limited size of this ruler's personal holdings allows for a far more efficient tax collection.
This character is leading an army in the field.
The recent civil infighting has taken a large toll on our lands, leaving our levies severely depleted.

A tribal ruler's ability to raise warriors and command respect among their vassals depends heavily on their §Gmartial§! skill and especially §Gprestige§!, balanced against their realm's §Rnumber of provinces§! and §RTribal Organization Laws§! which make it more difficult to properly exert their authority. High Tribal rulers are less dependent on their personal characteristics and have significantly decreased bonuses - and penalties - than Tribal rulers.
The [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] is undergoing a minor financial crisis and is currently unable to meet all of their obligations in a timely manner.
The [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] is undergoing a financial crisis, with soldiers and bureaucrats disgruntled at the untimely manner of their pay.
The [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] is undergoing a significant financial crisis. The treasury is deeply in debt and soldiers are going unpaid at times, undermining the emperor's authority.
The [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] is undergoing a major financial crisis. The treasury is deeply in debt and soldiers are going unpaid, severely undermining the emperor's authority.
The [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] is undergoing a severe financial crisis. The treasury is completely unable to meet its obligations and the army is in a state of open revolt.
The Royal Mint strikes coins in circulation in this character's realm, providing a general economic and trade boost.
The [Root.Religion.GetName] faithful of Britannia have been brought back together under the restored Archbishop of Londinium, through the patronage of [Root.GetTitledName].
The [Root.Religion.GetName] faithful of Britannia have been unified together through the established state church, under the patronage of [Root.GetTitledName].
The High Kings of Britannia have declared themselves successors of the great King Caratacus and the proper rulers of all the Celts.
This tribal ruler is vassal to a feudal realm, allowing for easier and more efficient development.
This character is a hero among the Anglo-Saxons, who believe that [This.GetSheHe] will destroy the Britons and restore the Saxons to their rightful place over Aenglaland.

The Bretwalda was recently met in a devastating defeat against his rivals and seems unable to defend the kingdom. Many are now wondering if [Root.GetSheHe] really has what it takes to rule over [e_aengland.GetBaseName].
This character's barbarian culture and customs is an affront to Imperial traditions and [This.GetSheHe] is widely regarded as an illegitimate pretender by all proper Romans.
Recent torrential rainfall has seen much of the lowlands in this province becoming flooded with water.
The peasants of this province have been harshly affected by the recent stormy weather, and their liege lord refused to provide any support.
Injustice and violence have upset the locals in this province.
Injustice and violence have upset the locals in this province.
The work of a religious delegation in this province has recently increased religion authority.
Restrictive laws are being enforced in this province to prevent an outbreak or to avoid the spreading of the dreaded 'Plague of Justinian'.
The diplomatic skills of your chancellor have made the traders in the town appreciate you more.
The diplomatic skills of your chancellor have made the feudal lords in this province appreciate you more.
This province has been settled by Britons fleeing from war and civil strife in their homeland.
This province has been settled by Britons fleeing from war and civil strife in their homeland.
This province has been settled by a large number of Britons fleeing from war and civil strife in their homeland.
This province has been settled by a large number of Britons fleeing from war and civil strife in their homeland.
This province has been somewhat depopulated by people fleeing war and disease for a safer home elsewhere.
Fields lie empty and towns abandoned as war, disease, and civil strife has led to massive emigration and the depopulation of this province.
Emigration across the sea to Britannia has left much of this province depopulated.
Virtually all of the province's population has left to seek new lands and homes in Britannia, leaving it mostly empty and open to foreign settlers.
The end of Aelle's reign has left Anglia in a state of uncertainty and instability. This ruler will have a difficult time holding the disparate tribes of the kingdom together.
The end of Aelle's reign has left Anglia in a state of uncertainty and instability. This ruler will have a difficult time holding the disparate tribes of the kingdom together.
The end of Cerdic's reign has left South Seaxe in a state of uncertainty and instability. This ruler will have a difficult time holding the disparate tribes of the kingdom together.
This county has been depopulated to a minor extent as a result of an epidemic or migration. When conditions improve it will repopulate quickly.
column3: La population de ce comté a chuté suite à une épidémie. Quand les maladies ne le frapperont plus, celui-ci se repeuplera rapidement.
column4: Aufgrund einer Epidemie ging die Bevölkerungsanzahl in dieser Provinz leicht zurück. Sobald die Krankheiten in dieser Provinz ausgemerzt sind, wird sich die Bevölkerung schnell erholen.
column6: Esta provincia ha sido despoblada a escala menor a causea de una epidemia. Cuando la enfermedad deje la provincia, se repoblará rápidamente.

column2: This county has been significantly depopulated as a result of an epidemic or significant migration. When conditions improve it will repopulate over several years.
column3: La population de ce comté a chuté modérément suite à une épidémie. Quand les maladies ne le frapperont plus, celui-ci se repeuplera pendant plusieurs années.
column4: Aufgrund einer Epidemie ging die Bevölkerungsanzahl in dieser Provinz erheblich zurück. Sobald die Krankheiten in dieser Provinz ausgemerzt sind, wird sich die Bevölkerung im Lauf einiger Jahre erholen.
column6: Esta provincia ha sido significativamente despoblada a causa de una epidemia. Cuando la enfermedad deje la provincia, se repoblará al cabo de unos años.

column2: This county has been depopulated to a severe extent as a result of an epidemic or substantial migration. When conditions improve it will take many years to repopulate.
column3: La population de ce comté a chuté fortement suite à une épidémie. Quand les maladies ne le frapperont plus, celui-ci se repeuplera pendant de nombreuses années.
column4: Aufgrund einer Epidemie ging die Bevölkerungsanzahl in dieser Provinz extrem zurück. Sobald die Krankheiten in dieser Provinz ausgemerzt sind, wird sich die Bevölkerung nur über viele Jahre hinweg erholen.
column6: Esta provincia se ha despoblado muy gravemente a causa de una epidemia. Cuando la enfermedad deje la provincia, llevará muchos años hasta repoblarse.

A number of new Roman colonies was recently founded in this province.

The Romanized administration of Maxima Cæsariensis is weakening, with the central government increasingly unable to exert its authority over the outlying areas. The realm is holding together for now, but a major shock from plague or rebellion without a strong figure to hold the realm together could spell the end of the unified province.
For as-yet unclear reasons, the Anglo-Saxon populace of this province have become more docile and peaceable in last few years.
The Anglo-Saxon population of this province is restless and some have risen in revolt, impairing the ability of the local authorities to recruit armies and defend the province.

The nobles of this province are chafing under the rule of what they see as a foreign ruler.\n\nThis modifier is applied to all Anglo-Saxon provinces that are not a de jure part of your §YPrimary Kingdom§!. §YIntegrating§! the duchy into your primary kingdom (if applicable) or successfully §Yuniting§! all of [e_aengland.GetName] will remove this modifier.

The Bretwalda was recently met in a devastating defeat against his rivals and seems unable to defend the kingdom. Many are now wondering if the Bretwalda really has what it takes to rule over [e_aengland.GetBaseName].
This character has recently seen one of [Root.GetHerHis] plots to success.

The [Root.Culture.GetName] people of [Root.GetName] are resentful of foreign rule over the region. If not handled properly the province could easily become the epicenter of a major revolt.

To fully assert our control we will need to §YPacify§! the province, though this will be a expensive and lengthy process. Appointing a vassal of the §Ylocal culture§! will remove the penalties during the pacification process - though we cannot be sure of their loyalty - while establishing §YMarcher Lords§! in the region will allow us to defend against revolts more easily.

[Root.GetPacificationStatus]

To fully assert our control we will need to §YPacify§! the province, though this will be a expensive and lengthy process. Appointing a vassal of the §Ylocal culture§! will remove the penalties during the pacification process - though we cannot be sure of their loyalty - while establishing §YMarcher Lords§! in the region will allow us to defend against revolts more easily.

[Root.GetPacificationStatus]

The [Root.Culture.GetName] people of [Root.GetName] are resentful of foreign rule over the region. If not handled properly the province could easily become the epicenter of a major revolt.

To fully assert our control we will need to §YPacify§! the province, though this will be a expensive and lengthy process. Appointing a vassal of the §Ylocal culture§! will remove the penalties during the pacification process - though we cannot be sure of their loyalty - while establishing §YMarcher Lords§! in the region will allow us to defend against revolts more easily.

[Root.GetPacificationStatus]

The [Root.Culture.GetName] people of [Root.GetName] are hostile to foreign rule and are resisting attempts to assert our authority over the region. If not handled properly the province could easily become the epicenter of a major revolt.

To fully assert our control we will need to §YPacify§! the province, though this will be a expensive and lengthy process. Appointing a vassal of the §Ylocal culture§! will remove the penalties during the pacification process - though we cannot be sure of their loyalty - while establishing §YMarcher Lords§! in the region will allow us to defend against revolts more easily.

[Root.GetPacificationStatus]

Years of Pacification Remaining: §R[Root.pacification_years_remaining.GetValue]§!\nPacification progress will be stopped if any holding in the province is occupied in an external war and can be reversed if any holdings are taken by revolts. The severity of Remote Hostility will decrease at §Y25§! and §Y10§! remaining years of pacification, disappearing completely at §Y0§!.

Current Major Revolt Progress: §R0§! [Root.GetNationalistRevoltProgressDesc]\nEstimated Revolt Size: [GetNationalistRevoltEstimatedSize]\nMajor Revolt progress ticks upwards every year depending on the number of unpacified provinces in the realm and its marches and their current pacification status. §YMarches§! reduce the contribution of their provinces to revolt progress, while provinces controlled by lords of the §Ylocal culture§! will have a slightly increased contribution. When revolt progress reaches §Y100§! you face the risk of a §RMajor Uprising§!, possibly drawing in hostile vassals and neighbouring lords.

Current Major Revolt Progress: §R[Root.nationalist_revolt_progress.GetValue]§! [Root.GetNationalistRevoltProgressDesc]\nEstimated Revolt Size: [GetNationalistRevoltEstimatedSize]\nMajor Revolt progress ticks upwards every year depending on the number of unpacified provinces in the realm and its marches and their current pacification status. §YMarches§! reduce the contribution of their provinces to revolt progress, while provinces controlled by lords of the §Ylocal culture§! will have a slightly increased contribution. When revolt progress reaches §Y100§! you face the risk of a §RMajor Uprising§!, possibly led by or drawing in hostile vassals and neighbouring lords.
More likely to be accepted as §GHigh King of Britannia§!
